data.title: Stream search results in sorted order
data.body: Search results come back in more or less random order, and get inserted into their sorted positions in the results list. This makes it annoying to browse the results while a search is ongoing.

data.title: TypeScript 2.0.10 Compile Errors - Ignoring typescript.tsdk path for Project and Global
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install TypeScript 2.0.10 globally and/or locally via npm
2. VS Code info message is "Version mismatch! global tsc (1.0.3.0) != VS Code's language service (2.0.10)..."
3. Add VS Code workspace or user setting to point to either local or global 2.0.10 tsdk folder path.
4. Error message no longer appears.
5. Build throws invalid compile errors with or without tsdk workspace or user settings.
6. OS also has Visual Studio 2013 and 2015 installed.
7. Running the command "tsc -version" in VS Code returns message "Version 1.0.3.0" 
8. Running command "tsc -version" in Visual Studio 2013 command prompt returns "Version 1.0.3.0" 
9. Visual Studio 2013 is actually using Version 1.8.5
10. Running command "tsc -version" in Visual Studio 2015 command prompt returns "Version 1.5.3" 
11. Visual Studio 2015 is actually using Version 2.0.6.0

data.title: Feature request: Allow scroll by page with ctrl+mousewheel combination

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: Currently it is not possible to bind the Ctrl+MouseWheel behavior. I would like to bind Ctrl+MouseWheelUp to the `scrollPageUp` action, and Ctrl+MouseWheelDown to `scrollPageDown`. This is the behavior I'm familiar with for many years from my [Mouse Fast Scroll](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=SamHarwell.MouseFastScroll) extension.

data.title: [scss] syntax support web component special selector (/deep/) in .scss files
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.1

The special `/deep/` selector is widely used as a way to style elements inside Angular2 Components. I don't consider this as a dup of #15695 or #7002 as this is a feature request.

This affect productivity and usability of VS code.  The `"scss.validate": false` is not a way. The commit-only-if-no-syntax-errors rule becomes ineffective; The `problems` pane keeps flooded with red lines, which are actually not errors. 

No syntax workaround for `/deep/` is known so far.

Steps to Reproduce: 
1. Create any .scss file
2. Type in a block with the `/deep/` selector
3. Wait a second until syntax check is done
4. The opening slash `/` is red-underlined saying error `} expected`

Example:
```
/deep/ .tooltip-component {
  top: 14.7rem;
}
```

VS Code will mark this as an syntax error, although it is actually not:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/20604326/20852692/f571efd0-b89b-11e6-82aa-d6e4c0ca4ec1.png)

data.title: Provide key short to navigate through filtered results while searching in default settings file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 Insiders 
- OS Version: macOS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Search something generic in the search bar of the default settings file, let's say 'And'
2. There are 83 matched results

Previously we were using search popup to do the query and we could keep pressing `enter` to navigate through the results but right now that's missing.

|---|---|---|

|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.3.8|

|project-manager|alefragnani|0.12.2|
|one-monokai|azemoh|0.2.3|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.1.2|
|tslint|eg2|0.6.7|
|vscode-great-icons|emmanuelbeziat|1.1.26|
|Angular2|johnpapa|1.0.2|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|10.0.0|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.0.3|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.2.0|
|Theme-1337|ms-vscode|0.1.2|
|angular2-inline|natewallace|0.0.16|
|nonbreakingspace|smlombardi|0.0.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|4.0.4|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.20.3|

|bootstrap-3-snippets|wcwhitehead|0.0.8|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. HTML file, have 2 tags, e.g. `td`, you want to add an attribute to, e.g. `class="foo"`
2. Click  next to the first `td`
3. Option-click in the second `td`.  You now have 2 cursors.
4. Start typing `class`.  Intellisense comes up.  
5. Choose "class"
6. only the first cursor completes.

See animated GIF below:
![dec-02-2016 15-39-00](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/20849682/d9c98f18-b8a5-11e6-9488-d291fb398359.gif)

*On an unrelated note, how can I control or theme those bracket matcher indicators?  I don't like the square, I'd prefer simple underlines.

data.title: Improve the text search progress bar
data.body: It's often not helpful at the moment - in some fast cases it sits at a low completion value for a second before the search is suddenly over. In other cases it's too eager and sits at 90% for a very long time.

data.title: Extensions: appending command to key binding
data.body:
VSCode Version 1.7

Hello,

I cannot find any documentation on that topic:

I would like to append a command to a key binding. Using the keybindings contribution of my extension seems to override the default command binding. I would like to implement a go to definition command (f12), which should be fired after the original at best (or if it fails).

```
"keybindings": [ {
        "command": "ui5ts.GoToDefinition",
        "key": "f12",
        "when": "editorTextFocus"
}, ... ]
```

Is the default behavior to override the key binding when adding a keybindings contribution? I read they are executed from "bottom to top", so I guess my command is executed first. Is the rest not fired, if my "when" is called first?

See also:
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/40927851/appending-a-command-to-a-already-existing-keybinding

data.title: New Default Settings comment have not space between // and start of comment
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 Insiders
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. File > Preferences > User Settings 

Notice that the comments no longer have a space between "//" and the comment text.
The convention for line comments is to have a space as well as improving readability.

```json
    //Controls the font size in pixels.
    "editor.fontSize": 14,
```

data.title: Default Settings Most Commonly Used title and first item hidden
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.8.0 Insiders
- OS Version:Window 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. File > Preferences > User Settings

The Most Commonly Used title and first item (window.zoomLevel) are hidden off the top of the readonly editor. They should start scrolled into view.

data.title: Viewing the list of symbols in the current script file does show variables within a function
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: 10.0.14393

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a ps1 file made up of just one function
2. Issue CTRL + P
3. Enter @ symbol
4. Only thing listed is the function name, none of the variables are showing.
5. Remove the function name and brackets (`function {}`) and then repeat.
6. You will now see the variables listed.
7. Open a file with multiple functions and the same thing, none of the variables will be listed.

![vscode_symbollistmissingvariables](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/11204251/20844939/00cb8a4e-b888-11e6-8c46-ecd15081c05b.gif)

data.title: Add enum option to show whitespaces inside selection only

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
So far `editor.renderWhitespace` accepts the following properties:

- all
- boundary
- none

I suggest we add a new option `selection` to only show whitespaces inside the current selected block of text. This can help conserving a readable code while getting insights when selecting a block of code.

data.title: Avoid sync fs-call at startup perf
data.body:
From https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/16382

[`exthost.api.impl`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/workbench/api/node/extHost.api.impl.ts#L450) does a `fs.realPathSync` for each extension on startup of the extension host main.

data.title: Integrated Terminal Not Able to Find bash.exe
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:06:37.428Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: None

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install "Bash on Ubuntu on Windows"
2. Install "VS Code", no changes to user settings (i.e. uses default settings)
3. Open "VS Code" and open an integrated terminal
4. Type "bash" in terminal 
   - will get error saying bash is not recognized
5. Navigate to bash.exe location (C:\Windows\system32)
6. type "bash" in terminal
   - will get error saying bash is not recognized
7. type "dir ba*", get no listing for bash.exe even though it exists
![vscode_no_bash](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/24261413/20839759/c5eba956-b87b-11e6-924c-fd839dc1c073.PNG)

data.title: API: Changing cursor position after edit creates selection
Avoid sync fs calls at ext host startup
data.body: To ensure the `_getOrCreateWorkspaceStoragePath` some sync fs calls happen. We should look into making them async such that other initialisation code can run in parallel.

data.title: StorageService: Avoid sync fs-calls

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body: The [`StorageService`](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/blob/master/src/vs/code/electron-main/storage.ts#L22) reads/write from/to disk in a synchronous matter. This happens at startup, meaning creating of other services and the window is blocked by it.

data.title: A  shortcoming of grammar color displaying in typescript
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
There is a shortcoming of grammar color displaying in typescript, as follow:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10753131/20834783/ffd37fd0-b8d1-11e6-868f-3560d1abfb9a.png)

```typescript
 interface Itest {
	a: 'a1' // a1 is good
		| 'a2' // a2 is good
		| 'a3' // a3 is good
	b: {
		a: 'a1'
			| 'a2' // oh , the color is not good !
			| 'a3' // oh , the color is not good !
	}
}
```
Sometimes we want to give clear indication of  the meanings of every items of  String Literal Types in inline comment, so we would break String Literal Types into many lines.
